nodes.documentation:
Standard ERC20 token with Short Hand Attack and approve() race condition mitigation.

 * Based on code by FirstBlood:
https://github.com/Firstbloodio/token/blob/master/smart_contract/FirstBloodToken.sol
nodes.name: StandardToken

nodes.documentation:
* Fix for the ERC20 short address attack

   * http://vessenes.com/the-erc20-short-address-attack-explained/
nodes.name: onlyPayloadSize

nodes.documentation:
Atomic increment of approved spending

   * Works around https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729
nodes.name: addApproval

nodes.documentation:
Atomic decrement of approved spending.

   * Works around https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729
nodes.name: subApproval

nodes.documentation: Burn extra tokens from a balance.
nodes.name: burn

nodes.documentation:
Upgrade agent interface inspired by Lunyr.

 * Upgrade agent transfers tokens to a new contract.
Upgrade agent itself can be the token contract, or just a middle man contract doing the heavy lifting.
nodes.name: UpgradeAgent

nodes.documentation:
A token upgrade mechanism where users can opt-in amount of tokens to the next smart contract revision.

 * First envisioned by Golem and Lunyr projects.
nodes.name: UpgradeableToken

nodes.documentation: Somebody has upgraded some of his tokens.
nodes.name: Upgrade

nodes.documentation: Do not allow construction without upgrade master set.
nodes.name: UpgradeableToken

nodes.documentation: Allow the token holder to upgrade some of their tokens to a new contract.
nodes.name: upgrade

nodes.documentation: Set an upgrade agent that handles
nodes.name: setUpgradeAgent

nodes.documentation: Get the state of the token upgrade.
nodes.name: getUpgradeState

nodes.documentation:
Change the upgrade master.

   * This allows us to set a new owner for the upgrade mechanism.
nodes.name: setUpgradeMaster

nodes.documentation: Child contract can enable to provide the condition when the upgrade can begun.
nodes.name: canUpgrade
